item.title: Colleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Death opens a door out of a little, dark room (that's all the life we have known before it) into a great, real place where the true sun shines and we shall meet." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You don’t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.

item.title: Colleen add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "What really knocks me out is a book that, when you're all done reading it, you wish the author that wrote it was a terrific friend of yours and you could call him up on the phone whenever you felt like it. That doesn't happen much, though." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Colleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you don't have time to read, you don't have the time (or the tools) to write. Simple as that." -- Stephen King

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "And by the way, everything in life is writable about if you have the outgoing guts to do it, and the imagination to improvise. The worst enemy to creativity is self-doubt." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Tomorrow may be hell, but today was a good writing day, and on the good writing days nothing else matters." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Lock up your libraries if you like; but there is no gate, no lock, no bolt that you can set upon the freedom of my mind." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Coco Chanel
item.description: "A girl should be two things: classy and fabulous." -- Coco Chanel

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Lilith Saintcrow
item.description: "Better to be strong than pretty and useless." -- Lilith Saintcrow

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Mother Theresa
item.description: "I know God won't give me anything I can't handle. I just wish he didn't trust me so much." -- Mother Theresa

item.title: Colleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The Christian does not think God will love us because we are good, but that God will make us good because He loves us." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "I can't go back to yesterday because I was a different person then." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Why, sometimes I've believed as many as six impossible things before breakfast." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Colleen add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies, said Jojen. The man who never reads lives only one." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Colleen add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A mind needs books as a sword needs a whetstone, if it is to keep its edge." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Colleen add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "Never forget what you are, for surely the world will not. Make it your strength. Then it can never be your weakness. Armour yourself in it, and it will never be used to hurt you." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Margaret George
item.description: "So I learned two things that night, and the next day, from him: the perfection of a moment, and the fleeting nature of it." -- Margaret George

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Margaret George
item.description: "When he comes into a room, you give a little gasp, deep inside, far inside,' someone once said when trying to describe what it meant to love." -- Margaret George

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you want to be a writer, you must do two things above all others: read a lot and write a lot. There's no way around these two things that I'm aware of, no shortcut." -- Stephen King

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Books are a uniquely portable magic." -- Stephen King

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Write with the door closed, rewrite with the door open." -- Stephen King

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Kill your darlings, kill your darlings, even when it breaks your egocentric little scribbler’s heart, kill your darlings." -- Stephen King

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "I have spent a good many years since―too many, I think―being ashamed about what I write. I think I was forty before I realized that almost every writer of fiction or poetry who has ever published a line has been accused by someone of wasting his or her God-given talent. If you write (or paint or dance or sculpt or sing, I suppose), someone will try to make you feel lousy about it, that's all." -- Stephen King

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "I'm a slow reader, but I usually get through seventy or eighty books a year, most fiction. I don't read in order to study the craft; I read because I like to read" -- Stephen King

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "Lighthouses don’t go running all over an island looking for boats to save; they just stand there shining." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "Joy is the best makeup." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Abigail Van Buren
item.description: "The best index to a person's character is how he treats people who can't do him any good, and how he treats people who can't fight back." -- Abigail Van Buren

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Hilary Mantel
item.description: "Some of these things are true and some of them lies. But they are all good stories." -- Hilary Mantel

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "Love the world and yourself in it, move through it as though it offers no resistance, as though the world is your natural element." -- Audrey Niffenegger
